channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 5 Takeaways From Taylor Swift’s ‘The Life of a Showgirl’ Movie
item.description: The pop star’s new album arrived with a limited-run film in which she debuts a video for “The Fate of Ophelia” and chats about the LP’s songs.

item.title: A Japanese Ski Resort Town Is Roiled by a Debate Over Immigration
item.description: Residents are protesting a planned housing facility for foreign workers, exposing the conflict between Japan’s need for labor and anxieties over immig...

item.title: Man Drives Car Onto Sidewalk Outside L.A. City Hall, Barricading Himself Inside
item.description: A man in a vehicle displaying a handwritten sign referring to President Trump refused to exit his car as the authorities shut down surrounding streets...

item.title: Trump orders Israel to stop bombing Gaza after Hamas partially accepts his peace plan
item.description: Hamas said it was willing to release the hostages and hand over power to other Palestinians, but that other aspects of the plan require further consul...

item.title: Trump Administration Is Said to Plan to Cut Refugee Admissions to a Record Low
item.description: Many of the slots would go to white South Africans and others facing “unjust discrimination,” according to people familiar with the matter and documen...

item.title: Supreme Court Lets Trump Revoke Deportation Protections for Venezuelans
item.description: The Trump administration has tried to end deportation protections for more than 300,000 Venezuelan immigrants.

item.title: Middle East Updates: Trump Says Hamas Is Ready for Peace and Tells Israel to Stop Bombing
item.description: Hamas said it would release the Israeli hostages but wanted to negotiate elements of the Trump plan. Later, in a video, President Trump said, “Everybo...

item.title: Journalist Mario Guevara Is Deported After Being Held Over 100 Days
item.description: The Salvadoran journalist was arrested in June while covering a “No Kings” protest outside Atlanta. Those charges were dropped, his lawyers said.

item.title: French Photojournalist Killed in Drone Attack in Ukraine
item.description: Antoni Lallican, a Paris-based photographer, is the first working journalist to be killed by a remotely piloted drone during the war, according to pre...

item.title: Trump Administration Is Said to Plan to Cut Refugee Admissions to a Record Low
item.description: Many of the slots would go to white South Africans and others facing “unjust discrimination,” according to people familiar with the matter and documen...

item.title: Here’s the latest.
item.description: The militant group responded to a proposal by President Trump to end the war in Gaza.

item.title: Lawsuit: Tesla design trapped a college student inside as it burst into flames
item.description: Krysta Tsukahara was in the back of a Cybertruck when the driver who was drunk and had taken drugs smashed into a tree, according to the suit.

item.title: Meet the only campus protester still locked up by Trump, a 32-year-old Palestinian who grew up in the West Bank with aunts and uncles in Gaza
item.description: “Most days I feel helpless,” says Leqaa Kordia, the New Jersey resident who has been jailed since March in a Texas immigration detention center.

item.title: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs gets 4 years in prison and is fined half a million dollars for case involving sex workers, violence and ‘freak-offs’
item.description: Since Combs has served a year in jail already, this sentence means he would be released in about three years.

item.title: America’s landlords settle claim they used rent-setting algorithms to gouge consumers nationwide for $141 million
item.description: Greystar, the nation's largest landlord, would pay $50 million under the proposed settlement agreement, with 25 others also settling.
